meta.title: Email Marketing Demystified: Build a Massive Mailing List, Write Copy that Converts and Generate More Sales
meta.author: Matthew Paulson

parts.title: Summary of Introduction
parts.body: Email Marketing Demystified is a book that provides a comprehensive guide to email marketing, outlining its effectiveness in modern-day business. Despite changes in technology and the rise of social media, email remains a powerful communication tool. With over 7 billion email accounts expected by 2021, the potential reach and engagement email offers are significant. This book details strategies for building mailing lists, creating engaging content, and monetizing effectively. It stresses that when done right, email marketing can significantly boost sales and your connection with your audience.

parts.title: Email Marketing Benefits and Preferences
parts.body: Email Marketing has a massive ROI; businesses earn $43 for every $1 invested. It's the most effective for lead acquisition and customer retention. Email marketing provides long-term results. Building a subscriber list is a lasting asset for revenue generation. Most Customers prefer email as a communication channel. 72% favor email from companies, and 95% find it useful. Email marketing outperforms social media; it's 40 times better for customer acquisition. Marketers believe in its excellent ROI more than in social media.

parts.title: Building and Optimizing Email Sign-Up Forms
parts.body: MarketBeat sends 40 million emails monthly and generates over 5 million page views with total revenue jumping from $6 million in 2018 to $8 million in 2019. The chapter emphasizes growing your email list through website sign-ups, highlighting the use of lead magnets to entice visitors despite fears of spam. Examples include free reports or discounts. For effective conversion, create opt-in forms with compelling headlines and descriptions that set expectations for your emails. Button text matters—even simple changes like using "Show Me Outfits I’ll Love" over "Sign Up Now" can significantly increase clicks. Consider testing different placements like pop-ups (entry or exit), welcome pages, and sidebars to see what maximizes subscriber sign-ups without affecting user experience.

parts.title: Maximizing Email Marketing & Subscriber Growth
parts.body: Thank you pages are valuable for capturing new actions from users. Users who reach these pages are already interested and more likely to click ads or signup for services. Opt-in forms are crucial for building a profitable email list. They minimize upfront costs compared to other methods, as subscribers through your site are essentially free. Create compelling copy and a desirable lead magnet to boost your mailing list growth. Testing opt-in forms' efficiency through split-tests is advised to improve rates. Bidsketch uses email marketing to convert website visitors into customers. Instead of pushing for trials, they focus on getting email sign-ups using various lead magnets like sample proposals. Their Drip campaign drives conversions by educating users on using proposals efficiently. Surveys and JTBD interviews are utilized to understand customer needs and tailor content effectively. Bidsketch credits their mailing list for a significant portion of their customers and advocates for experimenting with email processes to enhance marketing. Growing your list outside your website involves strategies requiring investment. Co-registration ads allow partnering on thank you pages on other sites. They may cost more but improve subscriber quality. Co-registration and lead generation must be monitored for effectiveness. Bids for subscribers should target those that bring better returns. Swap emails with similar site owners and utilize online tools like Safe Swaps to manage this. Email rentals involve renting ad space on another’s email blasts. Compromise quality by renting rather than buying email addresses. Creative ways to expand your list include social media and event strategies. Run contests or use QR codes on physical marketing. Utilize online platforms like YouTube for call-to-actions. Implementing Google AdWords or leveraging trade shows can also serve as effective list-building methods. Routinely revisit and refresh your list-building tactics to maintain engagement and subscriber growth.

parts.title: Optimizing Email Engagement and Sales
parts.body: In this chapter, Fossett highlights the importance of testing various aspects of your email marketing campaign such as subject lines, from-addresses, and calls-to-action. He emphasizes that different sending frequencies of your autoresponder series can greatly impact engagement and sales. Testing these components helps identify what resonates most with your audience. Also, using email effectively is crucial for business success. Fossett shares GMB Fitness' remarkable growth, managing a list of 60,000 subscribers with a 60% open rate, achieving 80% of sales through email subscribers. He advises that email marketing generates high ROI because it reaches almost everyone online and is cost-effective.

parts.title: Effective Email Marketing Strategies
parts.body: Your footer is crucial for staying compliant with anti-spam laws; it includes things like your unsubscribe link and company details. Every email should have a purpose—whether it's an announcement, engaging with users, promoting products, or gathering feedback. When emailing, you should follow the principle of "Give, Give, Give, Ask", meaning provide value before asking for something. This approach makes subscribers more open to purchase your products. Effective subject lines are key to getting your emails opened. Techniques like emphasizing important words, making personalized, or displaying numbers can greatly enhance open rates. Always test different strategies to see what works best for your audience. Whether promoting content, seeking feedback, or sharing announcements, the tone and content should align with the audience's interests and provide clear, concise information.

parts.title: Maintaining Email Deliverability
parts.body: To keep email deliverability high, use techniques like SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records to verify your domain's legitimacy. Double opt-in can reduce invalid sign-ups, but some marketers shift to single opt-in for faster list growth despite the engagement trade-off. User engagement (opens, clicks, replies) profoundly impacts whether emails land in inboxes or spam. Regularly clean your list, removing unengaged subscribers, as ISPs prioritize emails from domains with higher engagement. Monitor blacklists through MultiRBL to ensure optimal delivery and resolve spam complaints, maintaining a rate below 0.1%.

parts.title: Optimal Timing and Deliverability in Email Marketing
parts.body: When sending emails to a mailing list, consider the best times to send your messages for better engagement – Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday mornings around 8:00 AM or in the evening around 4:00 PM can be more effective. Use tools like Mail Tester to check your message's content for any spam triggers before sending. To avoid having your emails end up in Gmail’s Promotions tab, request that subscribers move your email to their Primary tab and encourage them to reply to your messages.

parts.title: Launch Email Prospecting Strategy
parts.body: When starting email prospecting, aim to send 5-10 cold emails each week through a personal account due to the low volume. Personalization is key; avoid form letters. If you get a positive response, arrange a call or meeting to discuss business. If no interest is shown, move on. If there's no response after 4-5 days, send a follow-up email. If there's still no reply after a third attempt and they're a good lead, move on. Prioritize multiple prospects over focusing on a single one, given the vast pool of potential customers.
